title: Define System Architecture
description: Design the overall architecture of the MetricStreamProcessor system, including components, data flow, and integration points. Consider the following aspects: 1) Data ingestion layer for handling high-volume metric data streams (consider Kafka or similar for real-time processing), 2) Data processing layer for real-time analysis and transformation (include Spark Streaming or Flink for fast data processing), 3) Data storage layer for persisting processed data (use distributed databases like Cassandra or Bigtable for scalability), 4) Scalability and load balancing mechanisms (consider Apache Hadoop YARN for resource management), 5) Monitoring and alerting components (use Prometheus for monitoring and Grafana for visualization), 6) Security and access control (implement OAuth2 or similar for secure authentication and authorization), 7) Fault tolerance and high availability (replicate data across multiple regions for redundancy), 8) Provide detailed documentation for each component and its interaction with others.

title: Gather Requirements
description: Collect and document functional and non-functional requirements for the MetricStreamProcessor system.

title: Design Data Ingestion Pipeline - Revised
description: Revised design for the data ingestion pipeline for receiving and processing large volumes of metrics data in real-time. The revised design takes into account the following aspects: 1) Support for various data sources and formats, including CSV, JSON, and XML. 2) Utilization of Apache Kafka as the primary message queue and Apache Spark Streaming for processing. 3) Implementation of robust data validation and preprocessing techniques. 4) Incorporation of error handling mechanisms for fault tolerance, including retry strategies and dead-letter queues. 5) Scalability and performance optimizations, such as horizontal scaling and efficient use of resources. 6) Integration with storage (Apache HBase), processing engines (Apache Spark), and monitoring and logging systems. 7) A comprehensive testing plan to ensure the reliability and robustness of the system.

title: Design Data Storage and Querying
description: Design the data storage and querying mechanisms for efficient storage and retrieval of large volumes of metrics data. The design should consider scalability, performance, and data durability requirements, as well as potential integration with existing data infrastructure such as Hadoop or Cassandra. Additionally, explore options for real-time and historical data querying.

title: Design Real-time Analysis Engine
description: Design the real-time analysis engine for performing complex computations and transformations on the incoming metrics data. This engine should be optimized for low latency and high throughput to handle large volumes of data in real-time.

title: Design User Interface (with Improvements)
description: Design the user interface for visualizing and interacting with the processed metrics data. Improvements include: real-time data visualization with dynamic updates, customizable dashboards that allow users to create their own views, alerting mechanisms with adjustable thresholds and notification preferences, user management system that handles authentication, authorization, and roles, and an intuitive and responsive design that adapts to various devices and screen sizes.

title: Define Security and Access Control
description: Define the security and access control mechanisms for the MetricStreamProcessor system. The definition should include authentication, authorization, data encryption, secure communication protocols, access control policies, and implementation of industry best practices, regulatory compliance requirements, and potential threats and vulnerabilities mitigation strategies. This task will ensure a secure and compliant platform that can withstand common cybersecurity threats.

title: Plan Deployment and Monitoring Strategy
description: Develop a comprehensive deployment strategy for the MetricStreamProcessor system, including infrastructure provisioning, containerization (e.g., Docker), orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes), load balancing, scaling, logging (e.g., ELK Stack, Logstash, Elasticsearch, Kibana), metrics collection (e.g., Prometheus), alerting, and observability using tools like Grafana and Splunk. The strategy should consider best practices for reliability, scalability, performance, and security.
